messageBody:
>So said lukatmyshu on 2003-07-10 --------------------
>I have an API that when I call it, puts an event on a queue
>somewhere. Eventually the event is passed to an EventHandler
>object. I'd like to test the process of placing an event on the
>queue and it being handled so I have a test method that posts the
>event, I implement my EventHandler interface and in the method that
>the interface provides I verify the data is what I posted.

Three separate behaviors.

1. Object A generates the expected events.
2. Object B consumes the expected events correctly.
3. The application chooses to have B listen to A.

Test them separately. Those are unit tests.

To test asynchronous communication like you want requires threading code, which isn't worth the effort (until it actually breaks).

Take care.
